text:
PERSONAL

C. GARRISON FATHMAN, M.D.

Birthdate: August 30, 1942
Citizenship: United States
Social Security #: 487-44-7552

EDUCATION

1964: University of Kentucky, Lexington: B.A.

1969: Washington University School of Medicine, St. Louis, Missouri: M.D.

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

1969-71: Intern and Resident in Medicine, Dartmouth Affiliated Hospitals, Hanover, New
Hampshire

1971-73; Postdoctoral Fellow in Immunology, Division of Immunology, Stanford University,
Stanford, California

1973-75: Clinical Associate, Immunology Branch, National Cancer Institute, National
Institutes of Health, Bethesda, Maryland

1975-77; Member, Basel Institute for Immunology, Switzerland

1977-81: Associate Professor, Department of Immunology, Mayo Clinic, Rochester,
Minnesota

1981-1989: Associate Professor of Medicine, Stanford University School of Medicine, Stanford,
California

1989-present: Professor of Medicine, Stanford University School of Medicine, Stanford,
California

HONORS

Phi Eta Sigma

Recipient, Research Career Development Award (1979-1984)
President, Association of Minnesota Immunologists (1979)

EDITORIAL BOARDS

Associate Editor, Annual Reviews in Immunology, (1981-present)

Journal of Immunolcgy (1979-1984), Sect

‘Chief (Cellular Immunology) 1986-1990

 

Transplantation (1979-1984)
Journal of Clinical Investigation (1985-present)

‘Annales de l'Institut Pasteur Immunologie (1985-1989)
Journal of Molecular and Cellular Immunology (1984-1988)

 

American Association of Immunology, 1975
Transplantation Society, 1979

‘American Federation for Clinical Research, 1981

‘American Society for Clinical Investigation, 1981

‘The American Diabetes Association, 1986

Clinical Immunology Society 1986

American Association of Physicians, 1987

The American Diabetes Association, California Affiliate, 1989

summary: M.D.Garrison Fathman is an American immunologist. He is a professor at Stanford University School of Medicine. His work has been published in the Journal of Molecular and Cellular Immunology, and the journal of Clinical Investigation. In 1989, he was awarded the American Diabetes Association’s prestigious ‘Phi Eta Sigma‘ award.
